In 2024, Intel explicitly stated that the NAND business had been fully divested as part of its broader strategic pivot, citing it as a past example of exiting non-core businesses like Intel Optane (2022) and the 5G smartphone modem business (2019). This progression shows a complete strategic disengagement from NAND memory, with the business moving from pending divestiture in 2022 to fully exited by 2024.

Additionally, the company recognized compensation expense based on the fair market value of the stock, adjusted for changes in stock price through the settlement date for cash-settled awards.
